column4: Hi can anyone in here help me, I have an ATI x850 and just installed xorg-driver-fglx and now when i run glxinfo it says that direct render is off. How can I turn it back on?
is fglrx the driver in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf?
anything on in your xorg log in /var/log?
there is a lot anything i am looking for?
something that starts EE and looks relevant i guess, you could pastebin the log?
wierd. no errors. still glxinfo says direct rendering: no ?
the only error I saw was about aiglx. Direct render still says no and I just noticed this Xlib:  extension "XFree86-DRI" missing on display ":0.0".
i've had that before. there was a solution burried in the forums. i think it had todo with having the right settings in xorg.conf as petal was saying.
theres some good guides for ati on the ubuntu forums, and for beryl on the beryl forums
is there any all inclusive that is easy to follow? I went through a lot of them and it really screw up my display last night
its a sod :( the one on the wiki should be good
i found it easier to install the drivers from ati.com than the ubuntu packaged ones. there is also a repository which has easy install and up to date ati drivers but i dont remember its name, sorry
